triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum DTI for Tier A applicants is 45%. The applicant's DTI of 55% indicates a high risk of financial strain, making the proposal non-compliant with affordability guidelines.

triageFlags.title: Excessive Loan-to-Value Ratio
triageFlags.description: The LTV ratio exceeds the maximum allowable limit for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to non-compliance with loan structure policies.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 85% for Tier A applicants. The current LTV of 91.11% exceeds this limit, indicating a higher risk of financial exposure for the lender.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio of 55% significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold of 45% for their credit tier (Tier A). Additionally, the LTV ratio of 91.11% surpasses the policy limit of 85% for Tier A applicants. These violations indicate a high risk of financial strain and non-compliance with underwriting policies.
